==Events==
*[[1256]] &ndash; The [[Augustinians|Augustinian]] [[monasticism|monastic]] [[order (religious)|order]] is constituted at the [[Monastery of the Holy Saviour|Lecceto Monastery]] when [[Pope Alexander IV]] issues a [[papal bull]] ''Licet ecclesiae catholicae''.
*[[1415]] &ndash; Religious reformers [[John Wycliffe]] and [[Jan Hus]] are condemned as [[Christian heresy|heretics]] at the [[Council of Constance]].
*[[1436]] &ndash; Assassination of the Swedish rebel (later national hero) [[Engelbrekt Engelbrektsson]]
*[[1471]] &ndash; [[Wars of the Roses]]: The [[Battle of Tewkesbury]]: [[Edward IV of England|Edward IV]] defeats a [[House of Lancaster|Lancastrian]] Army and kills [[Edward of Westminster|Edward]], [[Prince of Wales]].
*[[1493]] &ndash; [[Pope Alexander VI]] divides the [[New World]] between [[Spain]] and [[Portugal]] along the [[Line of Demarcation]].
*[[1626]] &ndash; [[Netherlands|Dutch]] [[explorer]] [[Peter Minuit]] arrives in [[New Netherland]] (present day [[Manhattan Island]]) aboard the ''See Meeuw''.
*[[1675]] &ndash; King [[Charles II of England]] orders the construction of the [[Royal Greenwich Observatory]].
*[[1686]] &ndash; The [[Municipalities of the Philippines|Municipality]] of [[Ilagan]] is founded in the [[Philippines]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Rhode Island]] becomes the first American colony to renounce allegiance to King [[George III]].
*[[1799]] &ndash; [[Fourth Anglo-Mysore War]]: The [[Battle of Seringapatam]]: The siege of [[Seringapatam]] ends when the city is invaded and [[Tipu Sultan]] killed by the besieging British army, under the command of [[George Harris, 1st Baron Harris|General George Harris]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Emperor]] [[Napoleon I of France]] arrives at [[Portoferraio]] on the island of [[Elba]] to begin his exile.
*  1814   &ndash; King [[Ferdinand VII]] of [[Spain]] signs the Decrete of the 4th of May, returning Spain to [[Absolute monarchy|absolutism]].
*[[1836]] &ndash; Formation of [[Ancient Order of Hibernians]]
*[[1859]] &ndash; The [[Cornwall Railway]] opens across the [[Royal Albert Bridge]] linking the counties of [[Devon]] and [[Cornwall]] in [[England]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; The [[Naval Battle of Hakodate Bay]] is fought in [[Japan]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; The [[National Association of Professional Base Ball Players|National Association]], the first professional baseball league, opens its first season in [[Fort Wayne, Indiana]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; [[Haymarket affair]]: A bomb is thrown at policemen trying to break up a [[Labor movement|labor]] rally in [[Chicago, Illinois]], [[United States]], killing eight and wounding 60. The police fire into the crowd.
*[[1902]] &ndash; 8 fishermen lose their lives in [[Galway Bay]], [[County Galway]], [[Ireland]] in the [[Galway Bay drowning tragedy]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; The [[United States]] begins construction of the [[Panama Canal]].
*  1904   &ndash; [[Charles Rolls|Charles Stewart Rolls]] meets [[Henry Royce|Frederick Henry Royce]] at the [[Midland Hotel (Manchester)|Midland Hotel]] in [[Manchester]], [[England]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[Royal Canadian Navy]] is created.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Italy]] occupies the [[Greece|Greek]] island of [[Rhodes]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[May Fourth Movement]]: Student demonstrations take place in [[Tiananmen Square]] in [[Beijing]], [[China]], protesting the [[Treaty of Versailles]], which transferred [[Republican China|Chinese]] territory to [[Japan]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; In [[Atlanta, Georgia]], [[mobster]] [[Al Capone]] begins serving an eleven-year prison sentence for [[tax evasion]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of the Coral Sea]] begins with an attack by aircraft from the [[United States]] [[aircraft carrier]] {{USS|Yorktown|CV-5|6}} on [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]] naval forces at [[Tulagi]] Island in the [[Solomon Islands]]. The Japanese forces had [[Invasion of Tulagi (May 1942)|invaded Tulagi]] the day before.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Neuengamme concentration camp]] near [[Hamburg]] is liberated by the [[British Army]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: [[German surrender at Lüneburg Heath]], the North German Army surrenders to [[Field Marshal]] [[Bernard Law Montgomery, 1st Viscount Montgomery of Alamein|Bernard Montgomery]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: [[Denmark]] is granted liberation, when Germany was forced to step out of Denmark thus ending 5 years of occupation. 
*[[1946]] &ndash; In [[San Francisco Bay]], [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marines]] from the nearby [[Treasure Island (California)|Treasure Island Naval Base]] stop a two-day [[riot]] at [[Alcatraz]] federal prison. Five people are killed in the riot.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The entire [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] football team (except for two players who did not take the trip: Sauro Tomà, due to an injury and Renato Gandolfi, because of coach request) is killed in [[Superga air disaster|a plane crash]] at the [[Superga]] hill at the edge of [[Turin]], [[Italy]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Ernest Hemingway]] wins the [[Pulitzer Prize]] for ''[[The Old Man and the Sea]]''.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[1st Grammy Awards]] are held.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[American civil rights movement]]: The "[[Freedom Riders]]" begin a bus trip through the [[Southern United States|South]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Kent State shootings]]: the [[Ohio]] [[United States National Guard|National Guard]], sent to [[Kent State University]] after disturbances in the city of Kent the weekend before, opens fire killing four unarmed students and wounding nine others. The students were protesting the United States' invasion of [[Cambodia]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; The ''[[Don't Make A Wave Committee]]'', a fledgling [[environmental organization]] founded in [[Canada]] in 1971, officially changes its name to "[[Greenpeace|Greenpeace Foundation]]".
*[[1974]] &ndash; An all-female Japanese team reaches the summit of [[Manaslu]], becoming the first women to climb an 8,000-meter peak.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Margaret Thatcher]] becomes the first female [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; Twenty sailors are killed when the [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Type 42 destroyer]]  {{HMS|Sheffield|D80|6}} is hit by an [[Argentina|Argentinian]] [[Exocet]] missile during the [[Falklands War]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[PEPCON disaster]] rocks [[Henderson, Nevada]], as tons of [[space shuttle]] [[fuel]] detonate during a fire.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Iran-Contra Affair]]: Former [[White House]] aide [[Oliver North]] is convicted of three crimes and acquitted of nine other charges. The convictions, however, are later overturned on appeal.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Latvia]] [[On the Restoration of Independence of the Republic of Latvia|proclaims the renewal of its independence]] after the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] occupation.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Israel]]i [[Prime Minister]] [[Yitzhak Rabin]] and [[Palestine Liberation Organization|PLO]] leader [[Yasser Arafat]] sign a peace accord regarding [[Palestine|Palestinian]] autonomy granting self-rule in the [[Gaza Strip]] and [[Jericho]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; A federal judge in [[Sacramento, California]], gives "[[Unabomber]]" [[Theodore Kaczynski]] four life sentences plus 30 years after Kaczynski accepts a plea agreement sparing him from the [[Capital punishment|death penalty]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Ken Livingstone]] becomes the [[London mayoral election, 2000|first]] [[Mayor of London]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; An [[EAS Airlines]] [[BAC One-Eleven|BAC 1-11-500]] [[EAS Airlines Flight 4226|crashes]] in a suburb of [[Kano]], [[Nigeria]] shortly after takeoff, killing 149 people.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Greensburg, Kansas]] is almost completely destroyed by a 1.7&nbsp;mi wide [[Enhanced Fujita Scale|EF5]] [[tornado]]&mdash;the first-ever tornado to be rated as such with the new [[Enhanced Fujita Scale]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; 3 people are killed and 62 injured in a [[2014 Nairobi bus bombings|pair of bombings]] on buses in [[Nairobi]], [[Kenya]].
